definitions.definition: a person who goes or travels on foot; walker.
going or performed on foot; walking.
of or pertaining to walking.
lacking in vitality, imagination, distinction, etc.; commonplace; prosaic or dull
having or showing acute mental discernment and keen practical sense; shrewd
inclined to quarrel or fight readily; quarrelsome; belligerent; combative.
extremely liberal in giving; very generous.
characterized by great generosity
causing or tending to cause sleep.
pertaining to or characterized by sleep or sleepiness; sleepy; drowsy.
something that causes sleep, as a medicine or drug.
talking or tending to talk much or freely; talkative; chattering; babbling; garrulous
characterized by excessive talk; wordy
a specialized idiomatic vocabulary peculiar to a particular class or group of people, especially that of an underworld group, devised for private communication and identification
the special vocabulary and idiom of a particular profession or social group
saliva flowing from the mouth, or mucus from the nose; slaver.
childish, silly, or meaningless talk or thinking; nonsense; twaddle.
to let saliva flow from the mouth or mucus from the nose; slaver.
to talk childishly or idiotically.
A visionary or dreamer.
Entanglement; confusion.
To cry, as a baby, young child, or the like; whimper.
to express distress or grief over; lament
to regard with regret or disapproval.
to mock  or jeer at (something or someone)
extremely wicked or villainous; iniquitous
payment (as a tip or bribe) to expedite service
to give a tip.
the language, especially the vocabulary, peculiar to a particular trade, profession, or group
Cold; chilly
definitions.example_sentence: There was an algid  texture to the air, causing everyone to shiver involuntarily.

definitions.definition: Having a mournful quality
the time of year when the sun is farthest north of the equator or farthest south of the equator
definitions.example_sentence: People all over the world have observed celebrations linked to the summer and winter solstices since ancient times.

definitions.definition: (of a person or mental process) Intelligently analytical and clear-thinking. Accurate and sharply focused
definitions.example_sentence: The incisive detective soon solved the crime.

definitions.definition: (of a subject or knowledge) Little known, obscure, abstruse
Obedient or attentive to an excessive degree
definitions.example_sentence: The obsequious service resulted in an excellent tip.

definitions.definition: (of language) Used in ordinary conversation; not formal or literary
definitions.example_sentence: His lecture was quite engaging due to his colloquial speech.

definitions.definition: Not honorable in character or purpose; shameful
Very weak or slight; insubstantial
Exclude (someone) from a society or group
Characterized by or arising from anger. (of a person) Easily made angry
definitions.example_sentence: He was always irascible and quick to get into a fight.

definitions.definition: Lacking knowledge; ignorant
definitions.example_sentence: His nescience of the topic was obvious.

definitions.definition: Having an irritatingly strong and unpleasant taste or smell. Angry and bitter
definitions.example_sentence: An acrid odor filled the room.

definitions.definition: Make (something) clear; explain
definitions.example_sentence: The presentation will help to elucidate the project.

definitions.definition: inclined to silence; reserved in speech; reluctant to join in conversation
definitions.example_sentence: a taciturn man, he almost never initiates a conversation

definitions.definition: to sear with a cautery or caustic
to stimulate or excite as if by an electric shock
definitions.example_sentence: The group is hoping to galvanize public opinion against the proposed law.

definitions.definition: a cell of indoctrinated leaders active in promoting the interests of a revolutionary party
definitions.example_sentence: claims that the problem will never be solved within the existing cadre of the state bureaucracy

definitions.definition: boisterously disorderly
definitions.example_sentence: the partying neighbors kept up their raucous laughter half the night

definitions.definition: inclined or eager to fight; aggressively hostile; belligerent; pugnacious.
